title: Viktor's ult... um what?
body:
His ult zaps people every 2 seconds but it lasts for 6.5 seconds? Like how does that work, is the remaining 0.5 seconds meant just to scare people away as a zoning tool or something? Also unless the ult is kept on top of someone it's really inaccurate to know when it will zap you/the enemy. How do viktor mains deal with this? Do they borrow their zhonya's psychological internal clock, reduce it by 0.5 seconds, with no indicators, then know exactly when it'll hit?!?!?

Edit apparently there is an indicator, just tested this. Yeah, there is.

replies.body: If I remember correctly, the "zone" that appears on the ground will show an inward pulse indicating the next attack. It's not much, but there is an indication.

awkward as it may be, the ult does have a visual indicator for when it's about to strike, the zone will begin to spark a little more, and then it will strike down with a zap, and I figure most Victor mains either watch for the lightning spark, or they just set the chaos storm loose and hope it hits.
